The best co-op survival horror game out there, no doubt. Perfect blend of comedy and teamwork, and most of the community is respectful of each other. Definitely beats L4D2, which seemed clunky to me, and lacked a true survival concept. Killing Floor is pure survival, although recent updates added a couple of objective-based maps, which are cool but don't compare to the regular game mode.
Pretty dope and fun but no one to play with T-T
Muito foda! Facilidade e simplicidade pros novatos e dificuldade e desafios aos veteranos, sem contar as soundtracks perfeitas.

I don't know why I didn't buy this game earlier. I fell in love with Killing Floor since the first time I played it. There is a large variety of realistic weapons to choose from. You collect cash by killing monsters and at the end of every wave, you go to a shop and buy weapons, ammo, protective gear, and much more. There is also an objective mode where for each map has a unique objective to comlete while killing the monsters. Co-op is key in this game. If you go on solo mode, chances are, unless you are really good at this game or you are on easy mode, that you will die within the first three waves. Staying in groups and working together is the onlything that will lead to success. This game is amazing. The repetitivness in this game NEVER gets old. Shootin monsters with friends is always a blast. The graphics are not incredible, but they aren't terrible either. Overall, this game gets a solid 8.5 out of 10. I believe that anyone who enjoys co-op shooters will love this game.
Fun game, especially when you play with your friends.

It gives you the tools, the stage, and hell bent difficulty, but what makes this game is the friends that you bring with you.
You'll enjoy this game as much as the company that is involved where you'll have intense moments where you'll have to work together to overcome those lovely demon spawn.

There is a degree of progression as you choose different "classes/perks" to help you on your way, but skill  and teamwork is a determined factor in success.

Great game, as long as you have others to play with.

[i] Originally posted on November 7, 2010 [/i]

Killing Floor is a really solid and entertaining zombie shooter that is a nice compliment to games like Left 4 Dead, although it plays very differently.

The core gameplay is all about killing different types of mutated enemies in coop with up to 6 others. The game's class system tends to be actually very fun, and it rewards long time players with some pretty nice bonuses for being high level. Sometimes the presence of level 6 players in a game can ruin it by making it impossible to get any kills, but generally the rewards for leveling up you classes are balanced and fun. There's a lot of room for creativity in ways to defeat the waves of mutants, and a door welding tool makes for great fun in doing so. Overall the gameplay is very solid.

The graphics are a bit dated, but it still manages to be really scary with the technology available. Based on the Unreal 2 engine, the game looks very much like a mod, but it is mostly visually attractive. Some of the levels can be entirely too dark and you have to really memorize their layouts before you can excel.

I'd recommend this game to any fans of shooters (coop or otherwise) looking for something old-school but fresh.
Es un juego que nunca deja de entretener. Destaco como característica primordial el énfasis en el trabajo en equipo para sobrevivir las constantes oleadas de tediosos mutantes.

L4D was the cinematic zombie killer, Killing Floor is the serious multiplayer zombie killer. Weapons galore, with six classes each with their own unique bonuses and perks and enough maps to keep you busy for a long time yet. Holiday events, free weapons/costumes every now and then, this is a rewarding game for multiplayer connoisseurs. About as single player as Quake3 is though.

This is the epitome of zombie "party" games. There are tons of fun, powerful weapons to buy with money you get from killing zombies and getting streaks. The waves get increasingly harder, and you can even customize your game to make it easier/harder, shorter/longer, depending on your preference and skill level. Unlike other zombie killers where you go in a linear line and fight the same groups every time, there are dozens of different enemies, maps, and downloadable weapons/maps to keep you entertained for countless hours. There are even seasonal events to change up the maps and enemies!

It's Counter-strike meets Left4Dead, and the product is KillingFloor.
Играть по сети очень интересно, для любителей зомби шутеров однозначно рекомендую.

A zombie shooter that does its job very well and with great variety. What makes Killing Floor different is that it takes casual, intermediate, and hardcore gamers into account by offering many difficulty levels. Besides that, don't expect an in-depth story. Killing Floor is about blood & guts, zombies, small & large weapons, and a lot of explosions. Did I mention you can play this game with 5 other people in the same game at the same time?

Whether you're the casual or notorious hardcore gamer, this will satisfy you from a few days to many months with friends or without.
1 OF THE BEST GAMES I EVER PLAYED!!!!!!!!!!!!

I just picked this game up on sale for $5, and let me just say that it's awesome! Killing Floor boasts LOADS of maps, 7 different classes/perks each with their own special stats and advantages, ZEDtime (slow mo that makes kills look especially sweet, even in multiplayer), lots of achievements, and no shortage of assorted weapons from fire axes, assault rifles, shotguns, SMGs, to flamethrowers and rocket launchers. If you're a fan of co-op and survival horror games, then this game is an absolute must. Haven't been able to stop playing in my free time thus far. And be warned: it's challenging for even the best players.

Great atmosphere on certain maps and still retains a good amount of humor.

Zeds, err specimens, offer enough challenge that if you're not careful you can get overwhelmed easily especially at higher difficulties. 

The minibosses have their own behavior and each player class has to fight a certain way in order to deal with them.

Speaking of player classes, it's quite varied and each requires a bit of skill to wield and have their own specific loadouts but you can also make use of other weapons from other classes.

Overall, great game with a great atmosphere. The devs also puts new content in the form of Events during certain times of the year for free.
I love this game. Amazing FPS Zombie shooter. Should be apart of everyones collection!
Truly the most fun survival horror game out there. ROBOT CHICKAN FTW
So Fun!

Killing Floor is one of the most amazing cooperative expeirences there is, dropping players into an ever-expanding pool of diverse and intresting community and official maps with nothing put a starting pistol. The gunplay feels perfect, the sounds and animations all run fluid and theres nothing like going into slow-mo as you blow some unlucky zed's limbs off one by one and watch them tumble to the floor, leaving a crimson stream of gore. The combat ramps up gradually, allowing players to slowly but steadily get used to the more brutal of the zed types, and the game itself feels natural to play even when you just start. There's a variety of perks and weapons that allow you to play to your own style and the modding community is one of the best ive ever seen. In short, i highly recommend Killing Floor.
That's an interesting cooperative game with a well-balanced perks. Every guy in team is an important part of the gaming process. So if you have a good team, i recommend you to choose KF
I recommend harry parfit buys this game

Fun playing game especially online when you have a great team.  I do wish there was a way to lockout low level players from suicidal and above games.  I also wish the gun DLC's purchased did more damage since they were paid for but they are not.   I also like the fact the game is kept up to date and releases seasonal events , keeps the game alive.

Probably one of the best zombie survival games I've played, think of the zombies featured in call of duty, but on steroids.

The mechanics of the game are pretty simple, kill zombies, buy weapons at the end of each round, kill a boss at the end. The gunplay in this game is amazing, the guns feel really powerful and it's never been more satisfying to shoot a zombie's head off with a weapon as simple as the pistol you start out with.

The graphics are a little dated, and the HUD isn't great, but don't let you distract you from the amazing game that is killing floor.

10/10

Excelente fps coop, una alternativa genial al Left 4 Dead, y que de hecho con el paso del tiempo llegó a su altura, salvo por sus escasos modos de juego, nos otorga variación de clases y armas a elegir, se podría decir que es esencial el trabajo de equipo donde no existen los "rambos", muy buenos gráficos y de prestaciones económicas para aquellos con una pc no tan potente, divertido y demencial, super recomendado :3
